abstract: Bank of America executives said on Tuesday that a government idea to write off tens of billions worth of mortgage debt was unworkable and warned that it would be unfair to untroubled borrowers.
snippet: Bank of America executives said on Tuesday that a government idea to write off tens of billions worth of mortgage debt was unworkable and warned that it would be unfair to untroubled borrowers.
lead_paragraph: Showing resistance for the first time against government pressure to write off tens of billions worth of mortgage debt, Bank of America executives said on Tuesday that the idea was unworkable and warned that it would be unfair to borrowers who had managed to stay current on their loans.

headline.main: Bank Chief Rejects Idea of Reducing Home Loans
headline.print_headline: Bank Chief Rejects Idea Of Reducing Home Loans

abstract: Big banks in Britain, Germany and France could gain an edge as their Wall Street counterparts move out of derivatives, proprietary trading and hedge funds, a report says.
snippet: Big banks in Britain, Germany and France could gain an edge as their Wall Street counterparts move out of derivatives, proprietary trading and hedge funds, a report says.
lead_paragraph: New financial regulations emerging from Washington could increase the bottom lines of some banks — just not banks on Wall Street.

headline.main: JPMorgan Says Dodd-Frank Favors Europe’s Banks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
